items.q: In what year did the Berlin Wall fall?
items.explanation: The fall of the wall officially began on November 9, 1989, paving the way for German reunification.

items.q: The Magna Carta was signed by King John in 1215.
items.explanation: It established the principle that everyone is subject to the law, even the king.

items.q: Alexander the Great was a Spartan king.
items.explanation: He was the king of the ancient Greek kingdom of Macedon.

items.q: What was the name of the route that connected China to the Mediterranean Sea through trade?
items.explanation: It facilitated the exchange of goods and culture for centuries.

items.q: Which US war was the battle of Gettysburg fought in?
items.explanation: It is widely considered the turning point of the war.

items.q: Who was the Soviet leader during the Cuban Missile Crisis?
items.explanation: He agreed to remove Soviet missiles from Cuba in exchange for US concessions.

items.q: What famous ship sank in 1915 after being torpedoed by a German U-boat?
items.explanation: This event shifted American public opinion against Germany in WWI.

items.q: What document did Martin Luther nail to a church door in 1517, sparking the Protestant Reformation?
items.explanation: It protested practices like the sale of indulgences.

items.q: What was the system of institutionalized racial segregation in South Africa called?
items.explanation: It was legally enforced until the early 1990s.

items.q: Which empire built the city of Tenochtitlan?
items.explanation: It was located on an island in Lake Texcoco where modern Mexico City is now.
